question.prompt: What is the principal (chief) question or concern you have regarding patient's condition?
In your own words, please provide a brief narrative of the details of the problem for which you are seeking a second opinion?
What is patient's current height in feet / inches?
What is patient's current weight in pounds?
What was patient's approximate weight in pounds 5 years ago?
What was patient's approximate weight in pounds 10 years ago?

question.prompt: Has patient ever been observed experiencing sleep apnea (stopping breathing while sleeping)? (choose one)
If yes, When did this begin?

How likely is patient to doze off or fall asleep in the following situations, in contrast to just feeling tired?
This refers to patient's usual way of life in recent times. Even if patient has not experienced the following conditions recently, try to think about how they would have affected the patient
Use the following scale to choose the appropriate number response for each situation:
0=would never doze
1=slight chance of dozing
2=moderate chance of dozing
3=high chance of dozing;

table_data.cell: Sitting, Inactive in a public place (Example: theater or meeting)
As a passenger in a car for one hour without a break
Lying down to rest in the afternoon when circumstances permit
Sitting quietly after lunch without alcohol
In a car, while stopped for a few minutes in traffic

question.prompt: Please choose the response below which best describes the way patient feels about the problems he/she has in controlling eating behavior. (choose one)

selection.text: I do not feel self conscious about my weight or body size when I'm with others.
I feel concerned about how I look to others, but it normally does not make me feel disappointed about myself.
I do get self conscious about my appearance and weight which makes me feel disappointed about myself.
I feel very self conscious about my weight and frequently I feel intense shame and disgust for myself. I try to avoid social contacts because of my self consciousness.

question.prompt: Please choose the response below which best describes the way patient feels about the problems he/she has in controlling eating behavior. (choose one)

selection.text: I do not have any difficulty eating slowly in the proper manner.
Although I seem to 'gobble down' foods, I do not end up feeling stuffed because of eating too much.
At times, I tend to eat quickly and then feel uncomfortably full afterwards.
I have the habit of bolting down my food, without really chewing it. When this happens, I usually feel uncomfortably stuffed because I've eaten too much.

question.prompt: Please choose the response below which best describes the way patient feels about the problems he/she has in controlling eating behavior. (choose one)

selection.text: I feel capable to control my eating urges when I want to.
I feel like I have failed to control my eating more than the average person.
I feel utterly helpless when it comes to feeling in control of my eating urges.
Because I feel so helpless about controlling my eating, I have become very desperate about trying to get in control.

question.prompt: Please choose the response below which best describes the way patient feels about the problems he/she has in controlling eating behavior. (choose one)

selection.text: I do not have the habit of eating when I am bored.
I sometimes eat when I am bored, but often I'm able to 'get busy' and get my mind off food.
I sometimes eat when I am bored, but occasionally, I can use some other activity to get my mind off of eating.
I have a strong habit of eating when I am bored. Nothing seems to help me break the habit.

question.prompt: Please choose the response below which best describes the way patient feels about the problems he/she has in controlling eating behavior. (choose one)

selection.text: I'm usually physically hungry when I eat something.
Occasionally, I eat something on impulse even though I am really not hungry.
I have the regular habit of eating foods that I might not really enjoy to satisfy a hungry feeling, even though physically I do not need the food.

Even though I am not physically hungry. I get a hungry feeling in my mouth that only seems to be satisfied when I eat food, like a sandwich, that fills my mouth. Sometimes when I eat the food to satisfy my mouth hunger, I then spit the food out so I won't gain weight.

question.prompt: Please choose the response below which best describes the way patient feels about the problems he/she has in controlling eating behavior. (choose one)

selection.text: I do not feel any guilt or self hate after I overeat.
After I overeat, occasionally I feel guilt or self-hate.
Almost all of the time I experience strong guilt or self-hate after I overeat.

question.prompt: Please choose the response below which best describes the way patient feels about the problems he/she has in controlling eating behavior. (choose one)

selection.text: I do not lose control of my eating when dieting even after periods when I overeat.
Sometimes when I eat 'forbidden food' on a diet, I feel like I 'blew it' and eat even more.
Frequently, I have the habit of saying to myself, ' I've blown it now, why not go all the way ' when I overeat on a diet. When that happens, I eat even more.
I have a regular habit of starting strict diets for myself, but I break the diets by going on an eating binge. My life seems to be either 'feast' or 'famine.'

question.prompt: Please choose the response below which best describes the way patient feels about the problems he/she has in controlling eating behavior. (choose one)

selection.text: I rarely eat so much food that I feel uncomfortably stuffed afterwards.
Usually about once a month, I eat such a quantity of food that I end up feeling very stuffed.
I have regular periods during the month when I eat large amounts of food, either at mealtime or at snacks.
I eat so much food that I regularly feel quite uncomfortable after eating and sometimes a bit nauseous.

question.prompt: Please choose the response below which best describes the way patient feels about the problems he/she has in controlling eating behavior. (choose one)

selection.text: My level of calorie intake does not go up very high or down very low on a regular basis.
Sometimes after I overeat, I will try to reduce my calorie intake to almost nothing to compensate for the excess calories I've eaten.
I have a regular habit of overeating during the night, It seems that my routine is not to be hungry in the morning but to overeat in the evening.
In my adult years, I have had week-long periods where I practically starve myself. This follows periods when I overeat. It seems like I live a life of either 'feast' or 'famine.'

question.prompt: Please choose the response below which best describes the way patient feels about the problems he/she has in controlling eating behavior. (choose one)

selection.text: I am usually able to stop eating when I want to. I know when 'enough is enough.'
Every so often, I experience a compulsion to eat which I can't seem to control.
Frequently, I experience strong urges to eat which I seem unable to control, but at other times I can control my eating urges.
I feel incapable of controlling urges to eat. I have a fear of not being able to stop eating voluntarily.'

question.prompt: Please choose the response below which best describes the way patient feels about the problems he/she has in controlling eating behavior. (choose one)

selection.text: I don't have any problem stopping eating when I feel full.'
I usually stop eating when I feel full but ocassionally overeat leaving me feeling uncomfortably stuffed.
I have a problem stopping eating once I start and usually I feel uncomfortably stuffed after I eat a meal.
Because I have a problem not being able to stop eating when I want, I sometimes have to induce vomiting to relieve my stuffed feeling.

question.prompt: Please choose the response below which best describes the way patient feels about the problems he/she has in controlling eating behavior. (choose one)

selection.text: I seem to eat just as much when I am with others (family, social gatherings) as when I am by myself.'
Sometimes, when I am with other persons, I do not eat as much as I want to eat because I am self conscious about my eating.
Frequently, I eat only a small amount of food when others are present, because I am embarrassed about my eating.
I feel so ashamed about overeating that I pick sometimes to overeat when I know none one will see me. I feel like a 'closet eater.'

question.prompt: Please choose the response below which best describes the way patient feels about the problems he/she has in controlling eating behavior. (choose one)

selection.text: I eat three meals per day with only occasional between meal snack.'
I eat three meals per day, but I normally snack between meals.
When I am snacking heavily, I get in the habit of skipping regular meals.
There are regular periods when I seem to be continually eating, with no planned meals.'

question.prompt: Please choose the response below which best describes the way patient feels about the problems he/she has in controlling eating behavior. (choose one)

selection.text: I do not think much about trying to control unwanted eating urges.'
At least some of the time, I feel my thoughts are pre-occupied with trying to control my eating urges.
I feel that frequently I spend much time thinking about how much I ate or about trying not to eat anymore.
It seems to me that most of my waking hours are pre-occupied by thoughts about eating or not eating. I feel like I am constantly struggling not to eat.'

question.prompt: Please choose the response below which best describes the way patient feels about the problems he/she has in controlling eating behavior. (choose one)

selection.text: I do not think about food a great deal.'
I have strong cravings for food but they last only for brief periods of time.
I have days when I cannot seem to think about anything but food.
Most of my days seem to be pre-occupied with thoughts about food. I feel like I live to eat.'

question.prompt: Please choose the response below which best describes the way patient feels about the problems he/she has in controlling eating behavior. (choose one)

selection.text: I usually know whether or not I am physically hungry. I take the right portion of food to satisfy me.'
Occasionally, I feel uncertain about knowing whether or not I am physically hungry. At these times, it is hard to know how much food I should take to satisfy me.
Even though I might know how many calories I should eat, I do not have any idea what is a 'normal' amount of food for me.

question.prompt: Please provide a number in pounds that corresponds to the four questions provided below:

selection.text: What is patient's dream weight, a weight that patient would choose if he/she could weigh whatever he/she wanted?

question.prompt: Patient's dream weight? (# of pounds)

selection.text: What weight would make patient happy, not as ideal as patient's dream weight, but one which would make patient happy to achieve?

question.prompt: Patient's happy weight? (# of pounds)

selection.text: What weight is acceptable? What weight would patient accept if he/she could not achieve happy weight?

question.prompt: Patient's acceptable weight (# of pounds)

selection.text: What weight, less than patient's current weight, would be unacceptable? What weight would patient consider unsuccessful, patient would be disappointed if it were his/her final weight?

question.prompt: Patient's disappointing weight? (# of pounds)
What is the single most important thing in patient's life that he/she expects to change as a result of weight loss? Please describe in as much detail as possible.

Please provide any additional medical information which patient's feels may have a bearing on patient's eligibility or affect patient's weight loss surgery. Also, please include any questions patient may have about the surgical procedure. Be as specific as possible in the information / questions below:

Please fill in the checkboxes below for any laboratory and / or diagnostic procedures patient has had done within the last year. Please be sure to include the date they were performed. (choose all that apply)
How did patient hear about us? (choose all that apply)
Name of physician?
Name of physician?
Name of physician?
Name of physician?
TV Station?
Radio Station?
Name of Newspaper?
Name of Magazine?
If other, please explain below:
What has been recommended regarding the patient's current condition? (surgery, medical management, etc.)
Which doctor made this recommendation?
Is there anything else you think would be helpful regarding patient's condition?
